result.execSummary:
The defendant Loretta K. Nagorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

No contact with any of the victims including Benjamin Molnar & Peter Christiansen. 
Not be on the property or have contact with Kohls, Walmart and the Elizabeth Inn.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

All prescriptions from one pharmary.
Sign all releases to monitor her treatment in terms of medications, psychological, psychiatric or medical. 
Engage in AODA if she hasn't had one in prison. 
Comply with all treatment recommendations for Aftercare while she is in prison.
Comply with all Aftercare and treatment, counseling concerning her mental health diagnosis.
Comply with any other counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by the DOC. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Write letters of apology to the victims in the cases that are mentioned.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Loretta K. Nagorski

records.addlTxt: Request from Judge Schroeder's JA to have Confidential PSI e-mailed for their case 18CM657

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Loretta K. Nagorski
Current: 1620 18th Street, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2017)
Prior: 324 Walker St, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Loretta K. Nagorski in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Loretta K. Nagorski in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All cases heard: 15CM423, 15CF406, 15CF407 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Neither attorney has corrections/additions. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
15CF406 Count 1 - 
3 years 6 months prison with 1 year 6 months initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision 
138 days credit

15CF407 Count 1 -
4 years prison with 1 year 9 months initial confinement followed by 2 years 3 months extended supervision, concurrent with 15CF406
138 days credit 

Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
No contact with any of the victims including Benjamin Molnar & Peter Christiansen. 
Not be on the property or have contact with Kohls, Walmart and the Elizabeth Inn.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from one pharmary.
Sign all releases to monitor her treatment in terms of medications, psychological, psychiatric or medical. 
Engage in AODA if she hasn't had one in prison. 
Comply with all treatment recommendations for Aftercare while she is in prison.
Comply with all Aftercare and treatment, counseling concerning her mental health diagnosis.
Comply with any other counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by the DOC. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs on each count including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Atty Knaapen makes statements re: letters of apology.

BY THE COURT: 
Write letters of apology to the victims in the cases that are mentioned. 

15CF407 Count 4 - 
Serve 1 year in jail concurrent to Count 1
138 days credit. 
Pay costs on each count including the DNA surcharge. 

15CM423 - 
Serve 1 year in jail, concurrent to all other sentences imposed. 
3 days credit. 
Pay costs on each count including the DNA surcharge.

Defendant Loretta K. Nagorski in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Loretta K. Nagorski in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:24 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 15CF406, 15CF407, 15CM423, 15CM433

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:
15CF406 Count 1 - NO CONTEST 
15CF407 Counts 1 & 4 - NO CONTEST
15CM423 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty in 15CF406, 15CF407 Counts 1 & 4, 15CM423 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF407 Counts 2, 3, 5 & 6 are dismissed and read-in. 
15CM423 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CM433 is dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 3/1/16 with copies forwarded to counsel. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of informations.
Defendant waives reading of informations. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Loretta K. Nagorski in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Loretta K. Nagorski in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF406, 15CF407
3:13 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearings. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Loretta K. Nagorski in court. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases: 15CF407, 15CF406, 15CM423, 15CM433 are heard today for initial appearances..
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.  
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Bond continued.
